stories.text:
It seems that the tech community accepts certain dogma in releasing products "MVP, agile, user-centered design, user studies, etc".

Yet if these principles are being followed, why does the tech industry keep pumping low quality products, while Apple is the opposite?

Apple's secrecy does not help. The few articles on google were either outdated (Job's legacy) or blog opinions and speculations. The few UX researchers on Linkedin were Apple contractors, with some roles opening recently in Austin.

What are they doing right that most tech companies miss? Or is it not design, but a distinctive leadership and strategy that works?

Some "more verifiable" sources:

[1] https://ux.stackexchange.com/questions/40448/how-does-apple-manage-to-deliver-its-user-experience

[2] https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o3uR6IDSHSM

Would love to hear from insiders if possible, thanks.
